title: Project Ashe is a P2W Skin
body: Now I think this skin looks badass as hell, but you really outdid yourselves with the "covert" theme Riot. I can barely see her ult when it's flying towards me and on top of that it's hard to tell apart from her Hawkshot.

replies.body: 100% agreed. Not only is the ult particle so similar to her Q autoattack particle but the hitbox is very misleading.

It's a blue swirling mass and not this rigid arrow everyone comes to expect. Thats what I honestly feels it is.  Also most people dont position themselves to respect ashe ult anyway. before this skin and especially after, getting off point blank ults is hilariously easy. respect the ult people.

(because right now, i rather watch the stack icons than the character if it's ready)

When they're traveling side by side, sure its easy to tell apart, especially when you consider this is a still image, but when you're playing and you only have split seconds to respond sometimes, its much more difficult. In addition to this, this is the first skin in a very long time in which I had to stop and say wait, which ability was that she just used?

To make matters worst, the first time I played against the skin was on ARAM, I'm not colorblind, but it is quite literally, the most difficult ability I've ever seen on ARAM, worst then Snow Day Ziggs and that's pretty bad. 

I've played against the skin enough now to know the difference, but the first few times I played against it, it was clear the Ashe had the advantage of knowledge. My friend in his first time against the skin was when we played in voice com together, he ended up dying due to being confused by what her ultimate looked like.

Even if it is only one death, skins shouldn't have a learning curve of ANY sort, no matter how little it may be.

Underworld TF Q cards in ARAM - those ARE difficult to see.
_Which is why I like to use that skin whenever I can there._ ^^

The arrow part is far more streamlined (or feels more streamlined due to extra particles) than Ashe Arrows typically are. Combine that with the Ult and Hawkshot traveling at the same speed, seeing it coming at you from the corner of your eye, etc, and that's where the problem occurs.

The problem isn't when you're shooting the arrows yourself. As you're the one shooting them you already know to expect which arrow will be fired.

The problem is when the Ashe is someone other than you so you don't have a biased expectation, a slightly delayed reaction due the more subtle particles could cost you your life or at least summoner spell.

It may just take getting used to (and I assume if you own the skin it would be faster getting used to it), but the point is a skin shoudn't NEED getting used to.
Sort of how the Lux Steel legion skin makes her ult a pencil thin line... P2W skins everywhere.... lol
Most skins don't have a learning curve to decipher what skill is what.
The effects don't match the hitbox well. I've had at least 10 ults I thought I missed, only to hit. If they made the arrow a bit wider it would be fine imo.
That happens a lot already with her default splash. So many times i think I miss my ult but it still hits. This isnt new.
It's a mistake guys... It's not that they want to make Project Ashe a p2w skin bruh

I know, I'm not mad at Riot but it needs to be brought to their attention and fixed ASAP. I've already been hit by about 3 or 4 Project Ashe ults which I wouldn't have been hit by if it had been any other Ashe skin.
One thing I do like about the skin tho is how the aoe of her ult is actually visible.

When I have spectated games with the new Ashe skin present, it doesn't seem bad at all. However, when I've played in game against the new Ashe skin I totally have experienced what you are talking about. When you have split seconds to make decisions the particle effects are hard to differentiate. This is even more true if you are already in the middle of a teamfight or small skirmish. I have both flashed an E and ignored an R because of this.
I've only really seen it in ARAM, but her particles are damn hard to see there

The similarity between E and Ult, imo, is they have almost the EXACT same particles for their respective AoE aspects. Combine that with the light-ass-blue graphics and if you weren't paying attention to the drone incoming, when it explodes you could very well assume it was ult. 

I can't see shit of her ult. It's way worse on ARAM too, I got hit by two entirely invisible-to-me arrows last game (hence why I'm here). I can't tell you what the arrow particle itself looks like at all. I don't get why it can't just be an electric--BRIGHT--blue pixelly arrow or whatever. Unless it is already. I couldn't tell you. 

These issues are all compounded by the fact that none of her abilities look remotely like they do in any other skin, no sparkles or bird or ice arrow, so it really messes with your split second recognition. Basically like a new champion with invisible abilities.
As I understand it, it's even worse for Colorblind peoples.
Yup its basically invisible

Had to burn my Flash to secure the kills since I didn't realize she got an excellent stun off. I don't think the enemy could tell either because they got hit extremely easily every time.

It isn't a P2W skin. If there are visibility problems, Riot is going to fix them.
They've done it in the past.

I think the problem is the transparency of the particle, they overdid it a bit so it merges with the background too much, the projectile itself is big enough but since it's almost white, it should be completely opaque.

It's similar to how Ghost Bride Morgana was when she released, except then it was her Q and her autos that looked so similar. They ninja-nerfed her auto projectile size so that it wouldn't appear as large as the Q projectile. 

A similar treatment here on Ashe , where they change the look of Hawkshot, may be more acceptable than changing the ult arrow.

Honestly, that's kind of the same thing that's always happened with Ashe, you never know if it's her Hawkshot or her Ult. It's kind of her thing. As for being able to see the ult, it's never really been a problem for me

At least it's not P2Lose like Morde's skins.

Not the first time they've released a p2w skin (or should I saw p2w particles?), won't be the last I'm sure.

Dark Valkyrie Diana, Steel Legion Lux, iBlitzcrank, Pulsefire Ezreal, just to name a few (or at least they all had an advantage at one time, but their particles were clarified... eventually. Or in the case of PF Ezreal, its Q hitbox was eventually cut down to actually match the 'classic' hitbox, because for some reason PF Ez's Q could actually hit from further away). There's even more in ARAM, where lots of particles blend into the landscape (especially the snow-based ones).


Don't get me wrong, I don't think they're doing it intentionally, it's just half-assed testing and lack of foresight.

Another I CANT SEE ASHE ULT  post but yet I have no problem seeing the ult. I really just think this is a person to person issue and people might just need eyes checked..........

Am i the only one who has no problem with seeing this ult?

I have 20/20 vision last time I got it checked. It may be clear to some people but not everyone processes colors the exact same way. The fact this thread and similar threads seem to be getting so much attention (I saw one on the League subreddit with over 1000 upvotes) should be proof enough that a big enough proportion of people have this problem that it warrants Riot's attention.

If it doesn't affect you then good for you, you don't need to worry about getting hit by stealth arrows that could potentially cost you a teamfight.
